:-1: This should be with the RA2 mod.

On 2015-06-26, at 11:24 AM, Matija Hustić notifications@github.com wrote:

> Functionality needed for the RA2 mod. Also described in #2330
> 
> Introduces a new upgrade called tesla. Its consumers would be
> 
> RequiresPower that would disable itself (thus not necessitating power for proper functioning of the actor) when enough tesla upgrades have been granted
> Armament that would increase range, damage and reload speed and modify rendering for a juiced-up tesla coil Normally tesla coils would use these traits.
> The upgrade's provider would be the TeslaBoost activity which requires the actor, that wishes to use this activity, to have the GivesTeslaBoost trait. Normally, tesla tanks and tesla troopers would use this trait.
> 
> I've tried to make things flexible by allowing
> 
> the modders to decide whether or not GivesTeslaBoost activates the TeslaBoost when the units are idle in the vicinity of a receiving tesla coil
> the player to force the tesla boost by explicitly giving an order to a tesla tank or tesla trooper to target a particular tesla coil
> the TeslaBoost activity to be used with mobile units

Ah they don't share common code here?

The RA2 mod currently does not have it's own DLL repo - @Phrohdoh plans to maintain one on his profile, but tbh I'm not a fan of scattering DLL repos.

<del>Besides that, we'll need the premature upgrade dictionary initialization to fix #8444.</del>

EDIT: Which popped up in this by accident only.
I thought that the RA2 mod on @Phrohdoh's profile was only there for art copyright reasons, but that all the code resides in this repository.
I haven't heard a concrete word on that yet and tbh yes, I'd welcome the DLL code residing in this repository too.
http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=26#16:03:55
This has been a long-planned feature for our RA mod, so the code is in the right place.
I'll see what I can do with @GraionDilach's suggestions. In the meantime, this should be marked as having changes requested.

Since this could be used for supression attacks and possibly Chrono Legionnaire attacks, perhaps `GivesTeslaBoost` should be `SupportsUpgrade` or `SupportUpgradeAttack` and `TeslaBoost` should be `SupportUpgrade` or `SupportUpgradeActivity`.
I'll see how much of these even stay when I try to do this using upgrade granting warheads. But `GrantMultiple` functionality will probably have to stay. So a preferred name would be appreciated

Is there a reason this can not be done with the existing code?

Perhaps:
- `GrantMultiple` => `GrantCount`
- `GivesTeslaBoost` => `GrantsUpgradeDuringAttack`
- `TeslaBoost`  =>`UpgradeDuringAttack`
People on the IRC channel question, perhaps the reason should by appended to the description.

Upgrade granting warheads is existing code, so this would make this pr smaller. Plus it's more logical.

See discussion in

http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=26#16:03:55
I asked GraionDilach to write the reasons here, but we thought a link to the discussion would suffice
Do you plan to merge it with the current GrantUpgradeWarhead?
Don't know yet, didn't have the time to look into it in detail. I'll do my best to do it elegantly, if possible without modifying existing functionality
Go ahead and take care of this @GraionDilach
Did a PR against your PR. That should solve 90% of the nits everybody can have against the implementation.

It seems that timed upgrades cannot go over level 1. This means that without changing this behavior, the tesla powerup cannot be implemented using upgrade granting warheads...
Apart from that, `AttackBase` only handles `DamageWarheads`. This means that a new trait would still be required to control the tesla powerup `GrantUpgradeWarhead`. It would nevertheless be more elegant with the warheads, but... Maybe see if the timed upgrades could be changed in a separate PR?

In the meantime, what should I do with this PR?

I started on a warhead refactoring quest a while back (see 7997), and I still need to do one more PR. That may handle the `GrantUpgradeWarhead` side of the problem (or at least pave the road for it).
The `TimedUpgrade`s can be refactored to have levels (which would most likely want its own PR).

If you are hopelessly stuck on those two points, I would suggest closing this PR until they are resolved.
I honestly can't find any reason in the code why this wouldn't work.

I've tried doing this thing locally using higher level timed upgrades and `GrantUpgradeWarhead`.

When the upgrade granting warhead's weapon's reload time is less than the upgrade duration, it's not the prettiest of sights when
- you put one tesla trooper next to a coil and then have the coil's range increased or
- you put two tesla troopers next to a coil without power

![tesla1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5747153/8509826/f4b38af0-22b4-11e5-87e1-f41ab1c91fda.gif)
![tesla2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5747153/8509835/38377aca-22b5-11e5-86cb-2ed4ea8c74a1.gif)

If you put the upgrade granting warhead's weapon's reload and the upgrade duration to be exactly equal, the situation is visually nicer, but risks breaking certain behaviors due to race conditions... One example is ordering the coil to attack ground - for a certain time it does but after a random number of zaps it just cancels the `ChargeAttack` activity because the coil's upgraded armament briefly becomes disabled.

Idea: leave how the timed upgrade granting works right now, just make the timed upgrades source dependent (one source can grant at most one upgrade level, if it grants a new one before the old one is revoked, the old one's duration is just refreshed; only if different sources grant upgrades can the aggregate level increase).

If I could get some opinions on this before attempting to file a new PR, that'd be great :)
I think that jumpy behaviour is acceptable tbh - but if you want to add that GrantUpgadeWarhead change, do it as a variable which modders can disable.
Depends on #8658.

#8658 has been merged.

I also made a new litning SHP which might look better, @matija-hustic, if you're interested, I add it to my PR against yours.
![openra-2015-07-07t200145z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1136302/8721503/5d505840-2bbb-11e5-8f2d-b4f2ca573bd5.png)

OK, so here's the version using upgrade granting warheads.

I was unable to take advantage of `AttackBase` and its subclasses since at most one of those per actor is allowed. And this means that it is effectively impossible to use `AttackBase` to implement a powerup weapon with a different cursor from the attack cursor used for other weapons.

This is why I've stuck to `GivesTeslaBoost`.

Also, for more natural behavior (when putting idle troopers next to a coil, they'll power it up, but stop powering up and attack as soon as enemies are present; on the other hand, when issuing an explicit order to power up a coil, the trooper will not stop powering up even if enemies approach), I've also kept `TeslaBoost`.

Maybe somehow modifying `AttackBase` could eliminate the need for these two classes?
@GraionDilach, sure, could you please add your artwork so that I can merge it?

Well maybe we're at the point where we should have `AttackBase` upgradable as well?
You should open an issue for what you said above about it.
